## Healthcare Project Types

::: {style="margin: 48px 0;"}
### Understanding Healthcare Facility Complexity

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr)); gap: 24px; margin: 32px 0;"}

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Community Clinic
**Size:** 500-2,000 sqm  
**Type:** Primary care  
**Complexity:** Medium  
**Timeline:** 5-6 days  
**Typical Cost:** £2,800-3,800/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- GP consultation rooms
- Basic diagnostic facilities
- Limited medical gas systems
- Standard HVAC requirements
- Reception & waiting areas
- Pharmacy & treatment rooms
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Day Surgery Center
**Size:** 2,000-5,000 sqm  
**Type:** Outpatient surgical  
**Complexity:** High  
**Timeline:** 7-8 days  
**Typical Cost:** £3,500-5,000/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- 2-6 operating theaters
- Recovery & pre-op areas
- Medical gas systems (full)
- HVAC with HEPA filtration
- Sterilization department
- Imaging & diagnostics
:::

::: {style="padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-left: 4px solid var(--bim-orange); border-radius: 4px;"}
#### Acute Care Hospital
**Size:** 10,000-50,000+ sqm  
**Type:** Full-service hospital  
**Complexity:** Very High  
**Timeline:** 9-10 days  
**Typical Cost:** £4,000-6,500/sqm

**Characteristics:**
- Multiple operating theaters
- ICU & HDU departments
- Emergency department
- Complex MEP systems
- Medical imaging suites
- Laboratory facilities
- Inpatient wards
- Central sterilization
:::

:::
:::

## Key Cost Drivers in Healthcare Projects

::: {style="margin: 48px 0; padding: 32px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
### Typical Acute Hospital Breakdown (per sqm)

::: {style="display: grid; grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr; gap: 32px; margin: 24px 0;"}

::: {style=""}
#### MEP Services (40-50%)
- HVAC with HEPA & controls: £600-900/sqm
- Medical gas systems: £400-650/sqm
- Electrical & backup power: £350-550/sqm
- Fire protection & alarms: £180-280/sqm
- BMS & nurse call systems: £220-350/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £1,750-2,730/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Structure & Envelope (25-30%)
- Foundations & substructure: £320-480/sqm
- RC frame & floors: £450-650/sqm
- External walls & cladding: £300-450/sqm
- Roofing & waterproofing: £120-180/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £1,190-1,760/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Internal Fit-Out (15-20%)
- Clinical finishes & flooring: £280-420/sqm
- Internal partitions: £180-280/sqm
- Doors & ironmongery: £150-220/sqm
- Suspended ceilings: £120-180/sqm
- Joinery & fixtures: £200-320/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £930-1,420/sqm
:::

::: {style=""}
#### Other Elements (15-20%)
- Lifts & patient hoists: £150-250/sqm
- External works: £180-280/sqm
- Clinical equipment prep: £220-350/sqm
- Preliminaries (12-15%): £600-900/sqm
- Contingency (8-10%): £380-580/sqm
- **Subtotal:** £1,530-2,360/sqm
:::

:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin-top: 32px; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-charcoal); border-radius: 8px;"}
<h3 style="color: #FFFFFF; margin-top: 0;">Total Typical Range: £5,400-8,270/sqm</h3>
<p style="color: #FFFFFF; font-style: italic;">(Acute hospital standard, excluding land, fees, and medical equipment)</p>

<p style="color: #FFFFFF;"><strong>NOTE:</strong> Actual costs vary significantly based on:</p>
<ul style="color: #FFFFFF; text-align: left; display: inline-block;">
<li>Facility type (clinic vs. acute hospital)</li>
<li>Operating theater count & complexity</li>
<li>Medical gas system requirements</li>
<li>HVAC complexity & filtration</li>
<li>HTM compliance level required</li>
<li>Clinical equipment integration</li>
</ul>
:::
:::

## Our Healthcare Estimation Process

::: {.process-steps}
::: {.process-step}
#### Initial Review & Compliance Check

**Day 1-2 (6-8 hours)**

**What We Do:**
- Review BIM model (IFC/Revit) or 2D drawings
- Verify clinical department requirements
- Assess HTM compliance needs
- Identify medical gas system scope
- Review infection control specifications

**Client Provides:**
- Architectural & clinical layouts
- MEP designs & schematics
- HTM compliance requirements
- Medical equipment schedules
- Room data sheets

**Output:** Project plan with compliance matrix
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Clinical MEP Analysis

**Days 2-5**

**What We Do:**
- Extract all medical gas systems
- Quantify HVAC with filtration
- Calculate electrical & backup power
- Measure nurse call & BMS infrastructure
- Verify pressure cascade requirements

**Technology:**
- BIM 5D MEP extraction
- Clinical engineering database
- HTM compliance checking
- System interdependency analysis

**Output:** Complete MEP quantity take-off
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Clinical Spaces Quantification

**Days 3-6**

**What We Do:**
- Quantify operating theaters
- Calculate clinical finishes
- Measure specialized equipment areas
- Count fixtures & fittings
- Assess imaging suite requirements

**Coverage:**
- Clinical departments
- Support spaces
- Back-of-house facilities
- Patient circulation areas
- Staff & administrative zones

**Output:** Clinical spaces BOQ
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Cost Application & Analysis

**Days 6-8**

**What We Do:**
- Apply healthcare-specific rates
- Factor in HTM compliance premiums
- Calculate medical gas costs
- Include infection control measures
- Add commissioning requirements
- Apply contingency (8-12%)

**Database Sources:**
- Healthcare benchmarks (UK/AU)
- Medical equipment specialists
- Clinical engineering contractors
- Recent hospital projects

**Output:** Detailed cost estimate by department
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Quality Review & Reporting

**Days 8-9**

**What We Do:**
- Clinical engineering peer review
- HTM compliance verification
- Medical gas system check
- Benchmark comparison
- Risk assessment

**Deliverables:**
- Executive summary (3-5 pages)
- Cost breakdown by department
- Clinical systems BOQ
- HTM compliance report
- Equipment integration schedule
- Risk register

**Format:** PDF + Excel workbooks
:::

::: {.process-step}
#### Presentation & Handover

**Days 9-10**

**What We Do:**
- Present findings to project team
- Explain clinical cost drivers
- Review compliance requirements
- Discuss value engineering
- Answer technical questions
- Provide ongoing support

**Meeting Options:**
- In-person (UK only)
- Video conference (all locations)
- Healthcare stakeholder presentations

**Support:** 60 days post-delivery included
:::
:::

::: {style="text-align: center; margin: 32px 0; padding: 24px; background: var(--bim-light-gray); border-radius: 8px;"}
**Typical Total Duration:** 7-10 working days from BIM model receipt to final report  
**Express Service:** Available for urgent projects (5-6 days) at 25% premium
:::

## Frequently Asked Questions

::: {.faq-section}
::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What makes healthcare estimation different from commercial buildings?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Healthcare facilities cost 40-60% more than commercial buildings due to complex MEP systems (medical gases, specialized HVAC), infection control requirements, 24/7 operational demands, and stringent regulatory compliance (HTM standards). Traditional estimation often underestimates clinical engineering complexity.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you estimate projects with HTM compliance requirements?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we have extensive experience with UK Health Technical Memoranda (HTM) standards including HTM 03-01 (ventilation), HTM 02-01 (medical gas), and HTM 08-03 (fire safety). We verify compliance and include all necessary specifications in our estimates.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How do you handle medical gas system estimation?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We systematically quantify all medical gas systems (oxygen, nitrous oxide, medical air, vacuum, AGSS) including piping, outlets, alarm panels, and manifolds. Our estimates reflect the complexity of installation, testing, and HTM 02-01 compliance requirements.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you estimate operating theater construction costs?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Absolutely. We have detailed knowledge of operating theater requirements including specialized HVAC (laminar flow, HEPA filtration), medical gas systems, surgical lighting, pendants, medical-grade finishes, and pressure cascade systems. We can cost different theater classifications and complexity levels.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Do you include clinical equipment in your estimates?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: We typically focus on building fabric and MEP systems, but can include allowances for clinical equipment integration (foundations, services connections, power requirements). Major medical equipment (MRI, CT scanners) is usually excluded but we clarify scope boundaries at project start.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: Can you cost phased hospital construction?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Yes, we regularly prepare estimates for phased delivery to maintain operational continuity. We can model decant requirements, temporary services, phasing logistics, and the cost impact of working within an operational healthcare environment.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: How quickly can you assess infection control upgrade costs?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: For infection control upgrades (HVAC modifications, pressure cascade systems, antimicrobial surfaces), we can typically provide costs within 3-5 days. This is particularly relevant for isolation ward conversions or pandemic response facilities.
:::
:::

::: {.faq-item}
::: {.faq-question}
**Q: What's your fee structure for healthcare projects?**
:::
::: {.faq-answer}
A: Fees vary based on facility type, size, and complexity. As a guide:
- Community clinic (500-2,000 sqm): £6,000-12,000
- Day surgery center (2,000-5,000 sqm): £12,000-20,000
- Small hospital (5,000-15,000 sqm): £20,000-35,000
- Acute hospital (15,000+ sqm): £35,000-60,000+

Express service carries a 25% premium. Contact us for a specific quote.
:::
:::
:::
